member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask
member.summary: Represents an IP subnetmask

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new IPv4 subnet mask with the value 0.0.0.0

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a new IPv4 or IPv6 subnetmask with the given value
member.param: The value to assign to the subnetmask. This value will be copied.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask.Parse(System.String)
member.summary:
Parses a string to a subnetmask. Possible inputs are:
A string in the format of XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX, where XXX is a number between 0 and 255 for IPv4 subnet masks.
A string in the format of XXXX, where XXXX will be put into the subnet portion of an IPv6 subnet mask.
A string in the format of XXXX:XXXX:XXXX:XXXX:XXXX:XXXX, where XXXX is a hex value between 0 and FFFF for IPv6 subnet masks.
member.returns: A subnetmask

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask.Parse(System.Int32,System.Net.Sockets.AddressFamily)
member.summary:
Parses a given prefix length to a subnetmask. Possible inputs are:
A number between 0 and 32 for an IPv4 address (InterNetwork)
A number between 0 and 128 for an IPv6 address (InterNetworkV6)
member.param: The prefix length of the subnetmask, e.g /24 as integer.
The address family of the subnet mask, InterNetwork or InterNetworkV6

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask.ToString
member.summary: Returns the string representation of this subnetmask
member.returns: The string representation of this subnetmask

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether this subnetmask equals another subnetmask
member.param: An object to compare to this subnetmask
member.returns: True, if the equals this subnetmask, false if not.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns the hash code of this subnetmask.
member.returns: The hash code

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask.TryParse(System.String,eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask@)
member.summary:
Tries to parse a string to a subnetmask. Possible inputs are:
A string in the format of XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX, where XXX is a number between 0 and 255 for IPv4 subnet masks.
A string in the format of XXXX, where XXXX will be put into the subnet portion of an IPv6 subnet mask.
A string in the format of XXXX:XXXX:XXXX:XXXX:XXXX:XXXX, where XXXX is a hex value between 0 and FFFF for IPv6 subnet masks.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the parsed subnet mask if parsing was a success.
member.returns: A bool indicating whether parsing was successfull

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask.TryParse(System.Int32,System.Net.Sockets.AddressFamily,eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask@)
member.summary: Tries to parse an integer to a subnetmask.
member.param: The short slash notation of the subnetmask, e.g /24 as integer.
The address family of the subnet mask, InterNetwork or InterNetworkV6
When this method returns, contains the parsed subnet mask if parsing was a success.
member.returns: A bool indicating whether parsing was successfull

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask.MaskBytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the mask bytes

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask.IntNotation
member.summary: Gets the integer form of this subnetmask, e.g. 4294967040 for 255.255.255.0. This works only for IPv4 subnet masks.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.Subnetmask.PrefixLength
member.summary: Gets the prefix length of this subnetmask, e.g. 24 for 255.255.255.0

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.Monitoring.TrafficAnalyzer
member.summary: This class represents the superclass of all traffic analyzers. Traffic analyzers must not have any output handlers also they must not generate any output and they must not edit any incomin frame The purpose of a traffic analyzer is to provide a stable base for doing multiple, paralell traffic analysis tasks without affecting the original frame. If you want to generate or change traffic on the fly, derive from TrafficModifier or TrafficHandler instead.

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficHandler
member.summary:
This class represents a Traffic Handler, a basic component for traffic analyzing and modifying. All traffic analyzers, modifiers and interfaces must derive from this class.
Threading issues This class owns one worker thread which calls HandleTraffic and all methods which are invoked by calls to the ISynchronizeInvoke interface. Thread safety for all objects which can be accessed from the outside has to be ensured. Invoking methods over ISynchronizeInvoke to prevent cross thread operations is not forced by this class.

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.RunningObject
member.summary: This class represents a running object

member.name: F:eExNetworkLibrary.RunningObject.bIsRunning
member.summary: This variable has to be set true or false according to the objects running state.. E.g. if the object's worker threads are supposed to stop, bSouldRun should be set to false. As soon as the worker threads really exit, bIsRunning is set to false.

member.name: F:eExNetworkLibrary.RunningObject.bSouldRun
member.summary: This variable has to be set true or false according to the objects desireable running state. E.g. if the object's worker threads are supposed to stop, bSouldRun should be set to false. As soon as the worker threads really exit, bIsRunning is set to false.

member.summary: Invokes a delegate on any external object with EventArgs.Empty as params and waits for the invoke's completion. This method automatically determines whether dynamic invoking is possible or a invoke over the ISynchronizeInvoke interface is required.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficModifiers.StreamModification.HTTP.HTTPStreamModifierCondition.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficModifiers.StreamModification.HTTP.HTTPStreamModifierCondition.AddChildRule(eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficModifiers.StreamModification.HTTP.HTTPStreamModifierCondition)
member.summary:
Adds a child condition to this condition. Child rules are validated and the result is and-conjuncted with the result of the parent rule.
If there are multiple child rules, and the result of at least one child rule is true, and the result of this rule is true, the end result is true.
If there are multiple child rules, and the result of all child rules is false, the end result is flase.
If the result of this rule is false, the end result is false.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficModifiers.StreamModification.HTTP.HTTPStreamModifierCondition.RemoveChildRule(eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficModifiers.StreamModification.HTTP.HTTPStreamModifierCondition)
member.summary: Removes the given child condition.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficModifiers.StreamModification.HTTP.Conditions.HeaderCondition.EvaluateRequestForResponse
member.summary:
Gets or sets a bool which indicates if the request for a response should also be evaluated.
This means, if this property is set to true, that if a request is a match, the according response will also be a match.
If this property is set to false, a request will be evaluated, regardless of the evaluation result for the response.

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.ISocket
member.summary: This interface represents a socket.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.ISocket.PushUp(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method has to accept any type of frames. If the frame pushed to the socket is matching the socket's binding, the frame should be decapsulated and true should be returned. Otherwise the frame should be discarded by this instance and false should be returned. After successfully processing the frame, the FrameDecapsulated event must be called with the decapsulated frame as paramater.
member.param: The frame to process. This frame instance should only be read, not edited.
A bool indicating whether the frame was delivered with a push flag.
member.returns: A bool indicating whether the submitted frame matches this socket's binding.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.ISocket.PushDown(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method has to accept any type of frames. The given frame should be encapsulated according to this socket's binding. After successfully processing the frame, the FrameEncapsulated event must be called with the encapsulated frame as paramater.
member.param: The frame to process. This frame instance should only be read, not edited.
A bool indicating whether the frame was delivered with a push flag.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.ISocket.Flush
member.summary: Forces the socket to send out all data waiting to be send immedeately, if possible.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.ISocket.PushDown(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method accepts an array of bytes. The given bytes are encapsulated according to this socket's binding. After successfully processing the frame, the FrameEncapsulated event is called with the encapsulated frame as paramater.
member.param: A bool indicating whether the frame was delivered with a push flag.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.ISocket.BindingInformation
member.summary: This accessor has to return a BindingInformation object containing information about this socket's binding.

member.name: E:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.ISocket.FrameDecapsulated
member.summary: This event should be fired whenever frame processing and decapsulation finished and the decapsulated frame can be pushed upwards the stack.

member.name: E:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.ISocket.FrameEncapsulated
member.summary: This event should be fired whenever frame processing and encapsulation finished and the encapsulated frame can be pushed downwards the stack.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.ISocket.IsOpen
member.summary: A bool indicating whether the socken can receive or send data.

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.Attacks.IMITMAttack
member.summary:
Provides an interface for all kind of man in the middle attacks.
When implementing such an attack, please use this interface for enhanced functionality, such as network map integration.

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficSplitting.PortRule
T:eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficSplitting.TrafficSplitterRule
member.summary: This class is the base of all conditional traffic splitter rules

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficSplitting.TrafficSplitterRule.AddChildRule(eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficSplitting.TrafficSplitterRule)
member.summary:
Adds a child condition to this rule. Actions of child rules are ignored, but they are validated and the result is and-conjuncted with the result of the parent rule.
If there are multiple child rules, and the result of at least one child rule is true, and the result of this rule is true, the end result is true.
If there are multiple child rules, and the result of all child rules is false, the end result is flase.
If the result of this rule is false, the end result is false.

member.summary: Removes the given child condition.

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.TCP.TCPFrame
member.summary:
Represents a TCP frame
If you change any properties of this frame, you have to manually calculate and set the checksum by crating an IP pseudo header and using the CalcualteChecksum method with it. The result must be saved into the Checksum property of this frame.

The offset in at which to begin

member.returns: The number of bytes written into

member.summary: This class is capable of initiating an ARP poison routing attack by spoofing ARP packets This class also includes its own MAC address analyzing component

member.summary: Adds an MITM Attack Entry to this MITM Attack. Adding victims not in direct connected subnets or not present in the interface's ARP-table will be without any effect. To avoid the last situation, it is wise to run an ARP scan first on the subnet to attack.
member.param: The victims to add to this attack.

member.summary: Removes a man in the middle attack entry from the victim list of this attack

member.summary: Clears the victim list

member.summary: Starts this attack

member.summary: Stops this attack and restores the ARP tables of the attacked hosts, which causes the traffic flow not to interrupt

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Attacks.Spoofing.APRAttack.Stop
member.summary: Stops thist traffic handler

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.IPInterface
member.summary: The IPInterface class provides an abstract base for interface implementations like the Ethernet interface. Interfaces are not supposed to use the OutputHandler, instead they provide a PacketCaptured event. When this event is invoked, each event handler receives a separate copy of the captured frame. This means, multiple handlers of the type DirectInterfaceIO can be attached to an IPInterface.

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase
member.summary:
This class represents the base for socket implementations. This class is designed to be modular and stackable.
Considerations:
[....] * * \ / / \ ********************************** * PushDown() FrameDecapsulated* * * * * * * * Parent Socket * * * * * * * *FrameEncapsulated PushUp() * ********************************** \ / / \ * * * * * * \ / / \ ********************************** * PushDown() FrameDecapsulated* * * * * * * * Child Socket * * * * * * * *FrameEncapsulated PushUp() * ********************************** \ / / \ * * [....]
If you use the ChildSocket and ParentSocket properties to assign to sockets to be child and parent, the connections of event handlers will be done automatically.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.InvokeExternal(System.Delegate,System.Object)
member.summary: Invokes a delegate on any external object with the given params and waits for the invoke's completion. This method automatically determines whether dynamic invoking is possible or a invoke over the ISynchronizeInvoke interface is required.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.InvokeExternalAsync(System.Delegate,System.Object)
member.summary: Invokes a delegate asyncronously on any external object with the given params. This method automatically determines whether dynamic invoking is possible or a invoke over the ISynchronizeInvoke interface is required.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.InvokeFrameDecapsulated(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame)
member.summary: Fires the FrameDecapsulated event asynchronously.
member.param: The frame associated with this event.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.InvokeFrameDecapsulated(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fires the FrameDecapsulated event asynchronously.
member.param: The frame associated with this event.
A bool indicating whether this frame was delivered with a push flag.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.InvokeFrameEncapsulated(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame)
member.summary: Fires the FrameEncapsulated event asynchronously.
member.param: The frame associated with this event.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.InvokeFrameEncapsulated(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fires the FrameEncapsulated event asynchronously.
member.param: The frame associated with this event.
A bool indicating whether this frame was delivered with a push flag.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.PushUp(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method has to accept any type of frames. If the frame pushed to the socket is matching the socket's binding, the frame should be decapsulated and true should be returned. Otherwise the frame should be discarded by this instance and false should be returned. After successfully processing the frame, the FrameDecapsulated event must be called with the decapsulated frame as paramater.
member.param: The frame to process. This frame instance should only be read, not edited.
A bool indicating whether the frame was delivered with a push flag.
member.returns: A bool indicating whether the submitted frame matches this socket's binding.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.Flush
member.summary: Forces the socket to send out all data waiting to be send immedeately, if possible.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.Close
member.summary: Closes this socket and frees all used resources.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.PushDown(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method has to accept any type of frames. The given frame should be encapsulated according to this socket's binding. After successfully processing the frame, the FrameEncapsulated event must be called with the encapsulated frame as paramater.
member.param: The frame to process. This frame instance should only be read, not edited.
A bool indicating whether the frame was delivered with a push flag.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.PushDown(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method accepts an array of bytes. The given bytes are encapsulated according to this socket's binding. After successfully processing the frame, the FrameEncapsulated event is called with the encapsulated frame as paramater.
member.param: A bool indicating whether the frame was delivered with a push flag.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.ProtocolParser
member.summary: Gets or sets the protocol parser of this socket. By changing it, it is possible to change the way the socket parses protocols.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.IsOpen
member.summary: A bool indicating whether the socken can receive or send data.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.ChildSocket
member.summary: Gets or sets the socket which is located under this sockets instance in the socket-stack and automatically registers the FrameDecapsulated event handler to ensure stack functionality.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.ParentSocket
member.summary: Gets or sets the socket which is located over this sockets instance in the socket-stack and automatically registers the FrameEncapsulated event handler to ensure stack functionality.

member.name: E:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.FrameDecapsulated
member.summary: This event is fired whenever frame processing and decapsulation finished and the decapsulated frame can be pushed upwards the stack.

member.name: E:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.FrameEncapsulated
member.summary: This event should be fired whenever frame processing and encapsulation finished and the encapsulated frame can be pushed downwards the stack.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.Sockets.SocketBase.BindingInformation
member.summary: This accessor has to return a BindingInformation object containing information about this socket's binding.

The destination (local) port to bind this socket to

member.summary: Decapsulates the given TCP frame if the binding of this socket matches the frame and invokes the FrameDecapsulated event when finished.
member.param: The TCP Socket ignores this parameter, since TCP push flags can be set in the TCP frame directly.
member.returns: A bool indicating whether the given frame is matching the binding of this socket

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficDescriptionFrame
member.summary:
This class represents a frame which carries several information about a captured frame, like capture time and the source interface.
Every frame should contain a traffic description frame. The IP interface classes are responsible for creating and adding an instance of this class to each frame. This frames contents are ignored when converting a frame to bytes.

member.summary: Gets a frame by it's type.

member.returns: The parsed frame or null, if the frame did not contain a frame with the specified type.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.ProtocolParsing.ProtocolParser.GetFrameByType(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a frame by it's type.
member.param: The frame which should be searched.

A bool indicating whether other frame types can be returned, if the protocol is known but no protocol provider is available and the searched frame is either a RawDataFrame or has already been parsed to a frame of another type.
member.returns: The parsed frame, a raw data frame with the searched frame's data or null, if the frame did not contain a frame with the specified type.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.ProtocolParsing.ProtocolParser.GetFrameByType(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Gets a frame by it's type.
member.param: The frame which should be searched.

A bool indicating whether other frame types can be returned, if the protocol is known but no protocol provider is available and the searched frame is either a RawDataFrame or has already been parsed to a frame of another type.
A list containing all protocols for which parsing was tried in the current recursion. This is needed for infinite recursion prevention.
member.returns: The parsed frame, a raw data frame with the searched frame's data or null, if the frame did not contain a frame with the specified type.

member.summary: Parses the frame as much as possible.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.ProtocolParsing.ProtocolParser.ParsePayload(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame)
member.summary: Must parse the payload of the given frame and set the parsed frame as the encapsulated frame.
member.param: The frame which has payload to parse. The frame cannot ba a raw data frame, since the payload protocol cannot be guessed.
member.returns: The type of the parsed frame or an empty string if the protocol was not known or not supported.

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.Attacks.Spoofing.DHCPSpoofer
member.summary: This class provides the function of a DHCP server but adds some attack functionalities. It is capable of forcing an existing DHCP server into starvation by requesting all its addresses with spoofed MAC addresses. Further this DHCP spoofer is capable of adding the stolen addresses to its own DHCP pool to release them, which does not work every time because the real DHCP server will respond with a DHCP NACK. The solution to this problem is to fill the pool of this DHCP spoofer with addresses for a diffrent subnet, then attack the original DHCP server and finally route between the subnets

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.Attacks.Spoofing.DHCPSpoofer.Cleanup
member.summary: Stops leasing and stealing addresses and releases all stolen addresses to avoid denial of service situations.

member.summary: Forces this DHCP spoofer to release all stolen addresses (Experimental)

member.summary: Pushes bytes to the output queue as they are.

member.summary: Stops this interface's processing threads and closes the underlying interface.

member.summary: Starts this interface's processing threads and opens the underlying interface for sniffing.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.EthernetInterface.Send(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame,System.Net.IPAddress)
member.summary:
Pushes this frame to the output queue and adds the ethernet component of this frame according to the given destination address and interface properties.
If fFrame contains an Ethernet component, the Ethernet component is removed.
member.param: The frame to send. This frame must contain an IPv4 or IPv6 frame.
The next hop's IP address of the given frame

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.EthernetInterface.Send(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame,System.Net.IPAddress,eExNetworkLibrary.EtherType)
member.summary:
Pushes this frame to the output queue and adds the ethernet component of this frame according to the given destination address and interface properties.
If fFrame contains an Ethernet component, the Ethernet component is removed.
member.param: The next hop's IP address of the given frame

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.EthernetInterface.AnalyzeARP(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame)
member.summary: Checks for available ARP messages and updates the ARP table.

member.name: M:eExNetworkLibrary.EthernetInterface.Send(eExNetworkLibrary.Frame)
member.summary: Pushes this frame to the output qeueue as it is, without changin anything.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.EthernetInterface.ARPTable
member.summary: Gets the ARPTable of this interface

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.EthernetInterface.MTU
member.summary: Gets the MTU, as queried from the operating system.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.EthernetInterface.AutoAnswerARPRequests
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool determining whether this interface should automatically answer ARPRequests and IPv6 neighbor solicitation messages for its IPAddresses.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.EthernetInterface.AddressResolutionMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of hardware address resolution to use. The default value is NDP for IPv6 and ARP for IPv4, since this combination is commonly used.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.EthernetInterface.FilterExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets the WinPcap kernel level filter expression associated with this interface. The filter expression will be optimized and the subnetmask used to compile the expression is the first subnetmask of this interface or 255.255.255.255 if no subnetmask is present.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.EthernetInterface.ExcludeOwnTraffic
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool determining whether this interface should automatically filter its own sent traffic from the input packets. As this method forces an interface re-open, it causes the WinPcap filter expression of this interface to be recompiled and some packets to pass the driver without being read.

member.name: P:eExNetworkLibrary.EthernetInterface.ExcludeLocalHostTraffic

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.TrafficSplitting.ConditionalTrafficSplitter
member.summary: This traffic handler is capable of filtering traffic according to specific rules. These rules define whether a frame should be forwarded to the OutputA or OutputB handler or should be dropped on a Match. If no rule matches, the frame is forwarded to handler A per default.

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.UDP.UDPFrame
member.summary:
This class represents a UDPFrame
If you change any properties of this frame, you have to manually calculate and set the checksum by crating an IP pseudo header and using the CalcualteChecksum method with it. The result must be saved into the Checksum property of this frame.

member.summary: Returns the checksum for this UDPFrame. This method works not always clean. An alternative is to set the checksum of an UDP frame to an empty byte array with the length of two.
member.param: The IP which should be included into the checksum calculation
member.returns: The checksum data

member.summary:
Returns the IPv6 pseudo header for this frame.
This pseudo header can be used to calculate TCP, ICMP and UDP checksums.
member.returns: The IPv6 pseudo header as byte[].

member.summary:
Returns the IPv6 pseudo header from the given params.
This pseudo header can be used to calculate TCP, ICMP and UDP checksums.

The source address to use in the checksum calculation.
The payload len to use in the checksum calculation.

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.Simulation.WANEmulator
member.summary:
This class represents a WANEmulator derived from Simulator. This class is capable of constraining speed, delaying the traffic, corrupting the traffic and more.
Please do not try to route corrupted traffic - protocol parsing will fail. Instead, use the WAN emulator between two DirectInterfaceIO Handlers.

member.name: T:eExNetworkLibrary.Monitoring.LibPcapDumper
member.summary:
This class is capable of dumping frames in the LibCap dumping format which can be read by wireshark and other protocol analyzers.
This class also provides the capability to create a new wireshark instance and send all captured frames to it in real time. This feature requires wireshark to be installed on the executing host.

A pointer to an integer where the data length is stored. This integer will be increased according to the number of bytes read

The index where this name is written into the corresponding DNS frame
member.returns: The compressed DNS name converted to bytes
